entry.title: France updates its crypto licensing regime to synchronize with MiCA
Drowning In Complexity: Bitcoin Miners Submerged By Soaring Mining Difficulty
entry.summary:
Bitcoin miners face mounting challenges as the difficulty adjustment in Bitcoin (BTC) mining continues to impact profitability and an energy crisis disrupts operations.¬†
Created by Satoshi Nakamoto, the difficulty adjustment protocol aims to maintain an average interval of 10 minutes between new blocks, affecting the mining process and costs.
The difficulty adjustment mechanism, a foundational aspect of Bitcoin‚Äôs protocol, has a direct influence on mining profitability. As the mining difficulty rises, so do the costs associated with the activity. This has led to a persistent trend of Bitcoin miners operating at a loss, primarily because of the escalating mining expenses.
Bitcoin Miners‚Äô Sustained Losses Over Time
Bitcoin miners have been grappling with a prolonged period of ‚Äúunderw‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripple vs SEC Fight Heats Up As Legal Exec Says The Regulator Can‚Äôt File An Appeal Yet
entry.summary:
The legal battle between the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Ripple Labs seems not to be ending anytime soon, as recent developments suggest that the feud could run into next year.¬†
The SEC Has No Right
Ripple‚Äôs Chief Legal Officer (CLO) Stuart Alderoty has responded to the SEC‚Äôs intention to file an appeal against Judge Torres‚Äôs partial summary judgment in favor of Ripple. According to Alderoty, the SEC has no ‚Äúright‚Äù to appeal against the decision just yet, which is why they are seeking leave of the court to file an interlocutory appeal instead. He further confirmed that Ripple will respond to the SEC‚Äôs filing next week.¬†
Alderoty tweeted:
The SEC does not have the ‚Äúright‚Äù to appeal just yet which is why they are asking permission to file an ‚Äúinterlocutory‚Äù app‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC Moves to Overturn Ripple Lab‚Äôs Landmark Court Victory
entry.summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is planning to move to court to challenge the ruling that granted Ripple Labs a partial win against the agency. The SEC has reportedly written to a judge in Manhattan to allow the federal court of appeal to examine the ruling, which was made in July. On July 13, US District Judge Analisa Torres ruled that the sale of Ripple‚Äôs cryptocurrency XRP on public exchange did not amount to a violation of the securities regulations. The decision was against the SEC‚Äôs argument that the blockchain payments platform sold unregistered securities to the public. Ripple‚Äôs Win against SEC In her ruling, Torres explained that Ripple did not violate the securities law because the purchasers of XRP did not expect to make a profit based on Ripple‚Äôs ‚Ä¶

entry.summary: Even though the prolonged period of cryptocurrency winter is behind us, digital asset market companies still feel its adverse effects. The latest examples are publicly listed companies Riot Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ: RIOT) and Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd. (TSX: GLXY), which reported negative financial results in the second quarter. entry.title: CPI Data Release: Could Bitcoin And Crypto See An Unexpected Boost?
entry.summary:
In the wake of today‚Äôs Consumer Price Index (CPI) data release at 8:30 am EST (12:30 pm GMT), the Bitcoin and crypto market is poised on the edge of its seat. With traditional markets and central banks closely monitoring the inflation metrics, the ripple effects on the digital asset market could be profound.
Wall Street is bracing for the July CPI data, with expectations that both the headline and core indices will rise by 0.2% from June. This would adjust the 12-month core CPI to 4.7% from June‚Äôs 4.8%, while the headline index (YoY) is predicted to ascend to 3.3% from June‚Äôs 3.0%.
Thomas Lee from Fundstrat Global Advisors took to Twitter, stating, ‚ÄúJuly CPI going to be revelatory.‚Äù He further elaborated on the potential outcomes: ‚ÄúIf >0.3% mom = bad. If <0.2% mom = good.‚Äù
Remarkab‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Network Adjusts: Mining Difficulty Rises 0.12% to 52.39 Trillion
entry.summary:
Bitcoin miners saw a slight increase in mining difficulty on August 9, 2023, at block height 802,368, as the difficulty rose 0.12% from 52.32 trillion to 52.39 trillion. Over the last 2,016 blocks, miners recorded an average hashrate of about 376.5 exahash per second (EH/s).
Miners Experience a Slight Increase in Bitcoin Mining Difficulty
Bitcoin‚Äôs mining difficulty became a bit more challenging on August 9, at block height 802,368. At that time, the network‚Äôs mining difficulty rose 0.12% after a 2.94% decrease two weeks earlier at block height 800,352.
The network‚Äôs difficulty is now 52.39 trillion, requiring miners to perform a great amount of computational work to find a valid hash. The higher the difficulty, the more computational power and energy is needed to mine ne‚Ä¶

entry.title: PayPal Stablecoin Sparks Political Fury: House Financial Services Committee In Turmoil
entry.summary:
According to a recent report by Bloomberg, Maxine Waters, the top Democrat on the House Financial Services Committee, expressed deep concern over PayPal Holdings Inc.‚Äôs stablecoin launch without a comprehensive regulatory framework.¬†
According to Waters, the absence of federal oversight poses risks to consumers and the stability of the cryptocurrency market.
Democrat Criticizes PayPal Stablecoin Launch
Stablecoins, digital tokens pegged to traditional assets like the U.S. dollar, have existed for nearly a decade. Primarily used for trading purposes, they have had limited adoption in consumer payments.¬†
Per the report, Waters highlighted the need for robust regulation, oversight, and enforcement mechanisms to protect consumers from potential harm caused by bad actors in the industry‚Ä¶

entry.title: Triumph Approaches? Ripple And SEC Prepare For Spring 2024 Jury Trial
entry.summary:
In the ongoing legal battle between Ripple Labs and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Federal Judge Analisa Torres has announced that the court intends to schedule a jury trial for the second quarter of 2024.¬†
The decision follows a partial summary judgment and short-term victory for Ripple and XRP holders, handed down by Judge Torres in a case that commenced in December 2020.
The court‚Äôs ruling acknowledged that Ripple‚Äôs institutional XRP sales were deemed an unregistered securities offering.¬†
However, the judgment found that programmatic sales of XRP did not fall under the same classification. As a result, the trial will focus on determining the regulatory status of XRP and its impact on the cryptocurrency industry.
Ripple And SEC Set For Epic Showdown
The la‚Ä¶

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdiƒá, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.
